document_data.caption: A map of the Ghostwalk.
document_data.name: Ghostwalk
document_data.text: I've killed him! I've killed him!
document_data.mainbody: The Ghostwalk was named after the harmless [[ghost]] of a long-dead Waterdhavian [[Nobility of Waterdeep|noble]] who roamed the alley with a [[sword]] drawn. The ghost staggered down the alley while whispering and getting progressively drenched in blood, then fading away.
document_data.Description: The alley was considered sufficiently safe for the rich inhabitants of the ward to walk by undisturbed. Like other alleys in the Sea Ward, it was clean and wide. It contained numerous [[shadowtop]]s that were favored by children to climb and play by.
document_data.Geography: The alley started from a branch in southern [[Murlpar Street]] and curled in a crescent shape within the city block between the [[Street of the Singing Dolphin]] and [[Morningstar Way]], providing access to homes and service access to the backs of businesses.
document_data.History:
{{fq
| text   = I've killed him! I've killed him!
| source = Whispers of the Ghostwalk's ghost
| float  = 
| width  = 320px
}}
The Ghostwalk was named after the harmless [[ghost]] of a long-dead Waterdhavian [[Nobility of Waterdeep|noble]] who roamed the alley with a [[sword]] drawn. The ghost staggered down the alley while whispering and getting progressively drenched in blood, then fading away.
document_data.Notable Locations: * [[Mystra's Arms]], an asylum, was located on the Ghostwalk.
